definition: familiarity at first sight
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
as/as if/such as
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead

sentences.english: Liu Mengmei is swept off his feet by the ghost of Du Liniang. A romance unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 柳梦梅与夜访的杜丽娘一见如故，展开一段人鬼情。

sentences.english: No wonder she wins, for she is all old-shoe charm.
sentences.chinese: 难怪她获得胜利，因为她有令人一见如故的魅力。

sentences.english: Even after meeting only once, they felt a kinship.
sentences.chinese: 虽然只是一面之缘，但他们一见如故。

sentences.english: Perhaps we have the fortune, to meet one day. There's no need for any reticence .
sentences.chinese: 也许我们有缘，相逢某一天，一见如故无庸讳言。

sentences.english: To hit it off does not mean that you and the other person are in love. At least not yet!
sentences.chinese: 一见如故并不意味着两人陷入爱情，至少现在还没有。

sentences.english: We hit it off and became good friends.
sentences.chinese: 我们一见如故，成了好朋友。

sentences.english: I like to visit my neighbor because our two children get along like a house on fire.
sentences.chinese: 我要去拜访一下邻居，我们的两个孩子一见如故。

sentences.english: Fielding was not surprised at the rapidity of their intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 菲尔丁对这种一见如故的样子并不觉得奇怪。

sentences.english: We know time is not long, but just clicked immediately.
sentences.chinese: 我们认识的时间不长，不过却一见如故。

sentences.english: When Karen met Jonathan, she immediately felt a connection.
sentences.chinese: 当凯伦遇见强纳生时，她马上感觉到一见如故。

sentences.english: But outside a public telephone stand, she met Song Yusheng, and the two hit it off and began dating.
sentences.chinese: 在大院的公用电话处，她偶遇宋宇生，二人一见如故。

definition: to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
intimate friendship/bosom buddies
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
congenial
to get to know each other/acquaintance
strangers coming together by chance (idiom)
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
friends despite the difference in age
best friend
very friendly/intimate
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
see 惺惺惜惺惺[xing1 xing1 xi1 xing1 xing1]
agreeing with one another/congenial
intimate friendship (idiom)
